catalog_info.title: Methods for Quantitative Data Analysis
catalog_info.description: This course reviews several of the core methods for analyzing data: data visualization and statistical graphics, simple programming with data, studying data dispersion, statistical inference under model uncertainty and related topics. The lectures will examine the real-world challenges of data analysis and explore how statistical methods can be used to learn from data, and draw valid statistical inferences.  The approach will be heavily applied involving data analysis with Stata and R. Students will develop their own empirical projects applying the methods from the course.
